alert.note: Alert for Clay; Putnam (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 01 at 9:04PM EDT until July 01 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Indiana, including the following counties, Clay and Putnam. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 904 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greencastle, Brazil, Knightsville, Harmony, Staunton, Fillmore, Carbon and Reelsville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
